chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melodie Charon Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Notice of competition
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Melodie Charon Mitchell in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Melodie Charon Mitchell.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. Signed Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed. 

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Melodie Charon Mitchell in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor who appeared by zoom.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has completed her TAD evaluation.   DPA Hearing scheduled in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Melodie Charon Mitchell in court, appear by video with attorney Colleen A Taylor, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Carson.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 7, 2022 - received

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Melodie Charon Mitchell in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Melodie Charon Mitchell in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melodie Charon Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
